turns.content: Can you recommend a trendy coffee shop in Berlin for digital nomads to work from?

I don't have personal experience, but here are some trendy coffee shops in berlin that are popular among digital nomads:

1. the barn - prenzlauer berg
2. st. oberholz - mitte
3. distrikt coffee - mitte
4. shakespeare and sons - friedrichshain
5. commonground - kreuzberg
6. silo coffee - friedrichshain
7. five elephant - kreuzberg 
8. bonanza coffee heroes - prenzlauer berg 

all of these cafes offer good coffee, free wi-fi and comfortable seating arrangements, perfect for a productive work session.
That's great, but do any of these coffee shops have private meeting rooms available for rent?

Yes, some of these coffee shops do have private meeting rooms available for rent. Here are some options:

1. The Barn in Prenzlauer Berg has a small meeting room available for rent.

2. St. Oberholz in Mitte has a meeting room that can accommodate up to 12 people.

3. Commonground in Kreuzberg has a meeting room that can hold up to 14 people.

4. Distrikt Coffee in Mitte has a meeting room that can hold up to 16 people.

5. Betahaus in Kreuzberg is not a coffee shop, but a co-working space that offers meeting rooms and private offices for rent.

It's always a good idea to call ahead and reserve a meeting room in advance to ensure availability.
I'm not a fan of coffee, do any of these coffee shops offer alternative beverages for non-coffee drinkers?

Yes, most of the trendy coffee shops in Berlin serve alternative beverages for non-coffee drinkers. Here are some options:

1. The Barn in Prenzlauer Berg offers a wide selection of teas.

2. St. Oberholz in Mitte offers various types of tea, hot chocolate, and fresh juices.

3. Distrikt Coffee in Mitte serves fresh juices, smoothies, and a variety of tea.

4. Shakespeare and Sons in Friedrichshain offers hot chocolate and various types of tea.

5. Commonground in Kreuzberg offers a variety of fresh juices, smoothies, and tea.

6. Silo Coffee in Friedrichshain serves a variety of teas and hot chocolate.

7. Five Elephant in Kreuzberg offers fresh juices, smoothies, and a selection of tea.

8. Bonanza Coffee Heroes in Prenzlauer Berg serves tea, fresh juices, and hot chocolate.

Most coffee shops also offer non-dairy milk options for those who are lactose intolerant or prefer plant-based drinks.
Do any of these coffee shops offer vegan food options as well? I don't want to have to leave to go find something to eat.

Yes, most of the trendy coffee shops in Berlin offer vegan food options. Here are some options:

1. The Barn in Prenzlauer Berg offers vegan croissants, sandwiches, and pastries.

2. St. Oberholz in Mitte offers vegan pastries, cakes, and sandwiches.

3. Distrikt Coffee in Mitte offers vegan sandwiches and salads.

4. Shakespeare and Sons in Friedrichshain offers vegan bagels, sandwiches, and soups.

5. Commonground in Kreuzberg offers vegan sandwiches, bowls, and salads.

6. Silo Coffee in Friedrichshain offers vegan toast, sandwiches, and salads.

7. Five Elephant in Kreuzberg offers vegan pastries, cakes, and sandwiches.

8. Bonanza Coffee Heroes in Prenzlauer Berg offers vegan sandwiches and pastries.

It's always a good idea to check with the coffee shop beforehand to ensure they have vegan options available.
